page.title: 05Shop Assistant Age 55. Anne
page.content: I went to St. John's Infant School and then the Silver Jubilee School. Our uniform was a gymslip, white blouse, blazer and a gaberdine mac. Teachers were much stricter then but that didn't do us any harm. Many children walked to school but I cycled. I left school at 14 years of age and found it easy to get my first job as a sales assistant in a toy shop. I earned 7/6d a week which is 37.5p today.The fashion in clothes in the 1940's was called the New Look. We had calf length circular skirts then tight split skirts. House styles have changed a lot in the last 30 years. I think houses are now built too close together and the kitchens and gardens are too small. Bury was very quiet then. There were no vandals or graffitti then. There was an outdoor swimming pool.
